Question: A police officer has the power to arrest you for:

Answers.Answer: failing to supply your correct name and address
having no warrant of fitness for your vehicle
failing to signal a right turn
failing to stop at a stop sign

Question: You are driving on a road with marked lanes and you are in the lane with an arrow showing a left turn only. What must you do?
What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: What does this sign mean?
What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: What is the speed limit from the time you pass an Accident sign until you are past the crash site?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Flush medians can be used when:
Directions from a police officer overrule traffic signals, road signs and give way rules at an intersection.
When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: When coming up to a roundabout you must give way to all vehicles that will cross your path from your left.
You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
Before making a lane change to your left, you must signal for at least 3 seconds. What else must you do?

Answers.Answer: Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights) to warn other road users
Use your vehicle hazard lights to warn other road users
Check your blind spot before moving left
Ensure that there are no oncoming vehicles

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?
What is the safest way to carry goods inside a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: On the floor by the driver’s feet
On the shelf near the rear window

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do when you see 2 red lights flashing outside a fire station?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and drive on carefully if the way is clear
Slow down and stop if any other vehicle is coming
Stop until the lights stop flashing

Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left
